about.name: Copenhagen
about.info_text: Copenhagen is the capital of Denmark and a vibrant, progressive city known for its beautiful architecture, rich history, and high quality of life. Situated on the eastern coast of the island of Zealand, Copenhagen offers a mix of old-world charm and modern innovation. Visitors can explore historic sites, enjoy a leisurely canal tour, or indulge in the city's world-famous culinary scene. With its commitment to sustainability and excellent public transportation, Copenhagen is a city that welcomes travelers from around the globe.
about.facts_text:
Population: 602,481 (City) / 1,346,791 (Metro)
Country: Denmark
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Danish, English
Currency: Danish Krone (DKK)
about.climate_text: Copenhagen, Denmark, experiences a temperate maritime climate with mild summers and cool winters. Summer temperatures typically range from 15°C to 25°C (59°F to 77°F), while winter temperatures hover around 0°C to 5°C (32°F to 41°F), with occasional frost and snowfall.

attractions_card.title: Tivoli Gardens
attractions_card.description: Tivoli Gardens is one of the world's oldest amusement parks, offering a mix of thrilling rides, beautiful gardens, and live entertainment. It's a must-visit for all ages.

attractions_card.title: The Little Mermaid
attractions_card.description: This iconic statue, inspired by Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale, is a symbol of Copenhagen. It's located on the waterfront and is a popular tourist attraction.

attractions_card.title: Nyhavn
attractions_card.description: Nyhavn is a picturesque canal district with colorful buildings, historic ships, and a lively atmosphere. It's a great place for dining, people-watching, and boat tours.

attractions_card.title: Rosenborg Castle
attractions_card.description: Rosenborg Castle is a beautifully preserved Renaissance castle that houses the Danish crown jewels. Visitors can explore its royal chambers and stunning gardens.

food_card.title: Smørrebrød
food_card.description: Smørrebrød is a traditional Danish open-faced sandwich, typically featuring rye bread topped with various ingredients like herring, liver pâté, and pickled cucumbers.

food_card.title: Danish Pastries
food_card.description: Denmark is famous for its delicious pastries, known as 'wienerbrød.' Try classic pastries like the cinnamon snail or the raspberry-filled 'spandauer.'

food_card.title: Nordic Cuisine
food_card.description: Copenhagen is renowned for its modern Nordic cuisine, with many Michelin-starred restaurants. Experience innovative dishes with a focus on local and seasonal ingredients.

hotels_card.title: Hotel d'Angleterre
hotels_card.description: This luxurious hotel offers elegant rooms, a Michelin-starred restaurant, and a prime location near the Royal Danish Theatre and Nyhavn.

hotels_card.title: Tivoli Hotel & Congress Center
hotels_card.description: Located near Tivoli Gardens, this modern hotel features comfortable rooms, stunning views, and convenient access to both the amusement park and the city center.

hotels_card.title: Generator Copenhagen
hotels_card.description: A trendy hostel in the city center, Generator Copenhagen offers a range of accommodation options, a vibrant atmosphere, and a bar with a selection of local craft beers.

transport_card.title: Metro
transport_card.description: Copenhagen's metro system provides quick and efficient transportation around the city. It's a convenient way to reach various attractions and neighborhoods.

transport_card.title: Biking
transport_card.description: Copenhagen is a bicycle-friendly city with dedicated bike lanes. Rent a bike and explore the city like a local, visiting parks, historic sites, and more.
